div0.head: *z
div0.entryFree:
*zz, zh=ta (q.v.), to/, indecl., seventh (later sixth) letter of Gr. alphabet (cf. IG 14.2420 ): as numeral z/
= e(pta/ and e(/bdomos (s/, i.e. vvau=, the digamma, being retained to represent e(/c, e(/ktos), but z'
=
7 , 000 . Zeta, being a double consonant (pronounced either as
zd or as
dz acc. to dialect and date), made a short vowel at the end of the foregoing syllable long by position; exc. before pr. names, which could not otherwise come into the hexam., a)/stu^ *zelei/hs
Il. 4.103
, 121 ; u(lh/essa^ *za/kunqos
h.Ap. 429
, etc.: afterwds. pronounced as Engl.
z, cf. zmh=nos
PCair.Zen. 151.4
(iii B.C.), zmu/rnhs ib. 9
(iii B.C.), a)mfizbh/thsin Mitteis Chr. 31 viii 6
(ii B.C.), cf. Ael.Dion. Fr. 187 ; sts. sz was written, e)nde/szmous
IG 22.1672.308
(iv B.C.), qusia/szein
IG 3.73
.

za/ [a^], Aeol. for dia/, rarely as Prep.,
za\ ta\n sa\n i)de/an
Theoc. 29.6
, cf. IG 12(2).484.3 (Mytil.); za\ nukto/s ap.Jo.Gramm. Comp. 3.3 ; za\
xw=ris e)/xhn
Sapph. Oxy. 1787
Fr. 3ii 18 ; zaba/llw, za/hmi, etc. as Prefix (cf. dia/),
very, in Ep. Adjs., zah/s, za/qeos, za/kotos, etc.; cf. zamene/w, za/ploutos, za/felos.

za=,= gh=, Inscr.Cypr. 135.8H. ; but zan, dub. sens. in the phrase u)vais zan, ib. 10 (fort.
= dia\ bi/ou ).
zaba/llw, Aeol. for diaba/llw,= e)capatw=, Hsch., EM 406.42 .

za/batos, on, Aeol. for diabato/s, Sapph. 158 .
= pi/nac i)xquhro/s (Paph.), Hsch. (cf. gabaqo/n, kaba/qa).
zableme/nws: mega/lws pepoiqw/s, Hsch. ; cf. blemeai/nw, a)bleme/ws.

za/botos, on , (bo/skw)
= polu/forbos, polu/kthnos , Hsch.
zabro/s, o/n, for za/boros (?),= polufa/gos, Hsch. , Phot. , Suid.
za/gklh, h(,= sq., Nic. Al. 180 . an ancient name of Sicilian Messene, from the shape of the natural mole which forms the harbour, Th. 6.4 , etc.

za/gklon, to/,
reaping-hook, sickle, Sicilian for dre/panon, Th. 6.4 , cf. Call. Aet.Oxy. 2080.73 . (za/gklion,= skolio/n, acc. to Str. 6.2.3 .)

za/gra, h(, and Dim.
za/grion, to/, a term of abuse, Timostr. 4 .
*zagrai=os, o(, epith. of Dionysus, Orph. Fr. 210 .

*zagreu/s, e/ws, o(, son of Zeus and Persephone, slain by the Titans and resuscitated as Dionysus, po/tnia gh=, *zagreu= te qew=n panupe/rtate pa/ntwn Alcmaeonis Fr. 3 ( EGF p.77 ), cf. E. Fr. 472.11 (anap.), Call. Fr. 171 , Nonn. D. 10.294 ; identified with *(/aidhs by A. Fr. 228 . (Glossed by
mega/lws a)greu/wn
Et.Gud. 227.37
.)

za/grh: bo/qros, la/paqon, Hsch.
za/gros, a, on,
barefoot, Zonar. , interpol. in Suid.

za/dhlos, on, for dia/dhlos, of a sail
with holes in it, Alc. 18.7 .

zaeleca/man,= dieleca/mhn, I
discoursed with, tini
Sapph. 87 (with vv. Il. ; za\ d' e)l. cj. Ahrens).

zazai=os: ei)=dos i)xqu/os, Opp. ap. Cyr. in An.Par. 4.182 ;
za/zeos
Cyr.
ap.Schmidt Hsch.
s.v. zaio/s .
za/hmi,= dia/hmi, part. zae/ntes, Hsch. : 3 sg. za/ei Id.: but za/ei: binei=, Id. is connected with bi/a (q.v.).

za_h/s, e/s, (za-, a)/hmi) Ep.
Adj.
strong-blowing, stormy, a)/nemos zah/s
Il. 12.157
, Od. 5.368 , prob. cj. in Hes. Th. 253 ; w)=rsen e)/pi zah=n a)/nemon
Od. 12.313
(cf. Hdn.Gr. 2.154 , 923 ); zaou=s *no/tou
AP 9.290
( Phil. ).

za/qeos [a^], a, on , also os, on
E. Tr. 256 (lyr.), 1075 (lyr.); poet. Adj. (used by Trag. only in lyrics):—
very divine, sacred, of places favoured by the gods, Il. 1.38 , al. (not in Od. ), h.Ap. 223 ; z. *pu/los, *)isqmo/s, Pi. P. 5.70 , I. 1.32 , cf. B. 2.7 ; na=sos
Id. 5.10
; *pe/lopos da/peda
Id. 10.24
; e)/nauloi
E. Ba. 121
(lyr.), etc.; *)/wlenos
A. Fr. 284
; of things, a)/nemoi
Hes. Th. 253
; xro/nos
Pi. Pae. 6.5
; klh=|des, sela=nai, E. Tr. ll.cc.; potamoi/
Ar. Nu. 283
(lyr.); molpai/
Id. Ra. 385
; timai/
Castorio 1
; later of persons, *)apo/llwn
AP 9.525.7
. Adv. -e/ws Hdn.Gr. 1.514 .

za^qerh/s, e/s, (qe/ros)
scorching, kau=ma
AP 6.120
( Leon. ).
zaio/s: ei)=dos i)xqu/os, Hsch. , cf. Plin. HN 9.68 (v. zazai=os).

za^kallh/s, e/s, (ka/llos)
very beautiful, Hsch.
zakelti/des, v. zek- .

za^kor-eu/w,
to be a za/koros, IG 3.162.12 , CIG 2298 (Delos).
za^kor-i/sou (gen. sg.), name of a kind of balsam, scanned as four long syllables, Aglaïas 23 (zakoru/tion Polydorusap.Sch.).

za^/kor-os, o( and h(,
attendant in a temple (more honourable than newko/ros acc. to Philem.Lex. (cf. Philol. 57.353 sqq.) in Reitzenstein
Gesch.d.Gr.Etym.
p.394 ), z. *)afrodi/ths
Hyp. Fr. 178
; qew=n
Plu. Cam. 30
; *dhou=s
IG 3.713.1
: abs., Anon. Oxy. 218ii14 ; ta\s i(erei/as kai\ ta\s z.
IG 12.4.14
(v B.C.), cf. ib. 7.1883 (Thespiae), Men. 126 , 311 , IG 12(2).484.21 (Mytil., late), Plu. Sull. 7 , etc.

za/kotos [a^], on ,
exceeding wroth, Il. 3.220 , Theoc. 25.83 ; of things, e)/gxos
Pi. N. 6.53
; u(/dwr
Id. Pae. 9.18
.

zakru^o/eis, essa, en, (kruo/eis)
very numbing, freezing, qa/natos
Alc. Supp. 12.8
.
za/kti: kri/mnou e)n e)/tnei (-nou= e)n e)/qnei cod.) e(fqw=|, Hsch.

za^kunqi/des, ai(,= koloku/ntai,
from Zacynthus, Hsch. , cf. AB 261 . za/l: me/ga, i)sxuro/n, polu/, Hsch.
za/la: qo/rubos, Id. zalageu=sa, f.l. for lal- or sal-, AP 9.412 ( Phld. ). za^lai/nw, = mwrai/nw , Hsch., EM 406.43 . za/lakes: e)xi=noi, Hsch.
zalau/da: kinou=, Id.

za^la/w, in Ep.
part. zalo/wsa . . xa/laza
driving hail, Nic. Th. 252 .

zale/gomai,
v. diale/gomai, zaeleca/man .
zalei/a, h(,= da/fnh *)alecandrei/a, Dsc. 4.145 .

za/leukos [a_], on ,
very white, f.l. in Orac. ap. Zos. 2.6 (pa/nleukos ap. Phleg. Macr. 4 ).

za_le/w,
v. zhle/w .

za/lh [a^], h( ,
squall, storm, driving rain, A. Ag. 656 , S. Aj. 352 (lyr.), etc.; koniortou= kai\ za/lhs u(po\ pneu/matos ferome/nou
Pl. R. 496d
; za/lh| pneuma/twn by a
storm of winds, Id. Ti. 43c ; xeimw\n kai\ z.
Hp. Insomn. 89
; z. a)ne/mwn
Plu. 2.993e
; be/lesi purpno/ou za/lhs, of the fiery rain from Aetna, A. Pr. 373 : metaph., za/lai
storms, distresses, Pi. O. 12.12 ; h( tou= bi/ou z.
Procop.Gaz. Ep. 47
; logismw=n za/lai
Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.211
; oi)/kou z., of women, Secund. Sent. 8 .

zalleu/w, Aeol. imper. 3 pl. zalleu\o/nton dub. sens. in Alc. Oxy. 1789
Fr. 1 i marg. (= Fr. 12 Lobel).

zalmo/s, o(, Thracian word for a
skin, Porph. VP 14 .

za/los [a^], o( ,
mud, z. i)luo/eis,= borborw=des ku=ma, Nic. Th. 568 ; za/lon (zalo/n cod.): phlo/n, Hsch. : metaph., Lib. Ep. 1144 .
za=los, za_lo/w, za_lwto/s, Dor. for zh=los, etc.

za/matos,=
za/batos
2
, Hsch. : zama/tion, to/,= tru/blion, Id. zamelh/s: me/ga me/los e)/xwn, Id.

za^men-e/w,
to put forth all one's fury, Hes. Th. 928 .

za^men-h/s, e/s, (me/nos) poet. Adj.
very strong, mighty, raging,
h.Merc. 307 (in Sup.
zamene/state); *ke/ntauros, a(/lios, Pi. P. 9.38 , N. 4.13 , cf. Sammelb.
5829.8 : once in Trag., z. lo/gos word
of violence or
enmity, S. Aj. 137 (anap.); also in late Ep. , z. xo/los
Opp. C. 3.448
: neut. as Adv., e)pi\ zamene\s kote/ousa
Nic. Th. 181
:—in form za^meno/s, h/, o/n, Orac. ap. Porph. Plot. 22 codd., Hsch.
zameri/tas, a, o(, Dor. word for makari/ths, Phot.

zamh=tai: megalourgoi/, Hsch.
zami/lampis, a kind of
stone, Orph. L. 263 (s.v.l.).
za_mi/a, za_mio/w, etc., Aeol. , etc., for zhm-.

za_miorgi/a, Elean for dhmiourgi/a, Schwyzer 409.6
(vi B.C.).

*za/n, *zano/s, o(, Dor. and Ion. for *zh/n, *zhno/s,
v. *zeu/s .

za^neke/ws or za^nekw=s, Adv., Aeol. for dianekw=s, cj. in Corinn. 9 ; cf. ai)zhneke/s: dihneke/s, ai)w/nion, Hsch.
zani/des: h(gemoni/des, Id.

za/pedon [a^], to/,
= da/pedon , Xenoph. 1.1 , IG 12(5).215 (Paros).

za^pi/melos [i_], on ,
very fat, Hsch.

zaplhqh/s e/s, (plh/qw)
very full, z. geneia/s
a thick, full beard, A. Pers. 316 ; z. sto/ma *mou/shs
full-sounding,
AP 7.75
(Antip.).

za/ploutos, on,
very rich, Hdt. 1.32 , E. Andr. 1282 , Lib. Decl. 30.12 , Jul. Ep. 89b .

za^po/ths, ou, o(,
toper, Hsch.

za/pu^ros [a^], on, (pu=r)
very fiery, e(/likes steroph=s
A. Pr. 1084
(anap.); pwth/mata Orac. ap. Porph. ap. Eus. PE 6.3 .

zarga/nh,
= taini/a , Sch. Opp. H. 1.100 .
za/rhkes (-ike/s cod. extra ordinem): e)pi/qeton pelagw=n (-argw=n Mus.), Hsch.
za/ros, o(, a bird of prey, Sch. E. Ph. 45 .

zarou=n: kaqeu/dein, Hsch.
zarto/s: zwmo\s tripto/s, Id. za_teu/w, zatrei=on, Dor. for zht-. zath/sasqai: ai)sqe/sqai, Id.; cf. zato/w. zato/s,
v. zhto/s .

zato/w,
= *fra/zw , EM 408.11 , cf. Hsch. :— Med. with aor.
Pass. ,= ai)sqa/nomai, Id. s.v. e)zatw/qh, e)zatwsa/mhn . zatra/phs, v. satra/phs .

zatrefh/s, e/s, (tre/fw) Ep.
Adj.
well-fed, fat, goodly, tau/rwn zatrefe/wn
Il. 7.223
; *fw/kas zatrefe/as
Od. 4.451
.

zatri/kion, to/,
the game of chess, Sch. Theoc. 6.18 . (From Skt.
catur-a[ndot ]ga- 'four members', through Pers. and Arab. )

zauki/trofos, on, (saukro/s)
tenderly reared, Hsch. (zakki/- cod.). za^feggh/s, e/s,
very bright, Id. za^felh/s, e/s,
violent, with Adv. -lw=s, Id.; cf. e)pizafelw=s;= pa/nu a)felh/s, Suid. :—also za/felos, on, Nic. Al. 556 , EM 408.17 .

zaflegh/s, e/s, Ep.
Adj.
full of fire, of men at their prime, a)/llote me/n te zaflege/es tele/qousin . . a)/llote de\ *fqinu/qousin a)kh/rioi
Il. 21.465
; of
fiery horses, h.Hom. 8.8 .
shining, bright, a)/stra Orac. ap. Eus. PE 3.15 ; se/las
Nonn. D. 2.26
.

zafoi/taisa,
v. diafoita/w .

zafo/ros, on,= polufo/ros, Hsch. :—hence zafore/w,
to be fertile, prob.l.Id. za/xma (zagma/ cod.): h(ni/a, Id.

za/xolos [a^], on, (xolh/)
= za/kotos , AP 9.524.7 .
zaxra_h/s, e/s, prob.= za/xrhh/s, Epic.in Arch.Pap. 7p.6 .

zaxreih/s,
v.l. for zaxrhh/s . Adv. zaxreie/s
violently, Nic. Th. 290 .

zaxrei=os, on, (xrei/a)
very needy: c. gen., z. o(dou=
one who wants to know the way,
asks eagerly after it, Theoc. 25.6 .

zaxrhh/s, e/s, used only in pl.,
attacking violently, furious, raging, me/nos *bore/ao kai\ a)/llwn zaxrhw=n a)ne/mwn
Il. 5.525
(-xrei- most codd.); of warriors, zaxrhei=s . . kata\ krat era\s u(smi/nas
12.347
, cf. 13.684 ; cf. zaxrah/s, zaxreih/s. (From za^- and xra/w (B); cf. e)pixra/w (B).)

za/xru_sos, on,
rich in gold, *qrh|ki/a, e)mpola/, E. Alc. 498 , IT 1111 (lyr.): in late Prose, Lib. Or. 11.140 .
za/xu^tos [a^], on ,= dia/xutos, Nonn. D. 19.347 .

za/y, h(,
surf, kari=das h( z. e)kfe/rei ki)xqu/dia
Cratin.Jun. 13
, cf. Euph. 3 , Simm. 11 ; po/ntou . . peristei/nei a(lukh\ z. Dionys. Iamb. ap. Clem.Al. Strom. 5.8.47 (who says some took z.= pu=r).

za/w,
v. zw= .
*zbelsou=rdos, o(, divinity worshipped in Thrace, Rev.Ét.Gr. 26.247 :—also in forms *zberqou=rdos, *zbelqi- or *zberqi-ou=rdos, etc.
zbi/x (zabi/x cod.): leuko/n, Hsch. (hence kna\c zbi\x leuko/n cj. Salm. in Thespis 4 ; cf. knaczbi/).

za^/men-ze, inseparable Suffix, denoting
motion towards:—prop. representing -sde, as in *)aqh/naze, *qh/baze, qu/raze for *)aqh/nasde, *qh/basde, qu/rasde: but sts. found with sg. Nouns, as e)/raze, xama=ze, *)olumpi/aze, *mounuxi/aze, cf. A.D. Adv. 194.18 .

ze/a, h(,= zeia/, D.H. 2.25 , Dsc. 2.89 (
v.l. zeia/ ): nom. sg. ze/h
PPetr. 2p.69
(iii B.C.).
= libanwti\s ka/rpimos , Dsc. 3.74 .
the roof of a horse's mouth,
Hippiatr. 1 , 8 . (With ze/a
1
, cf. Skt.
yávas (masc.), Lith.
javaĩ (masc. pl.) 'corn'.)

zege/ries, oi(, a Libyan word,= bounoi/, but used as a name for a kind of
mouse, Hdt. 4.192 ; zegeri/ai, Hsch.

zeia/, h(, usu. in pl. zeiai/ (sg., v. infr.),
one-seeded wheat, Triticum monococcum, used as fodder for horses, Hom. only in Od. ; pa\r d' e)/balon zeia/s, a)na\ de\ kri= leuko\n e)/meican
4.41
, cf. 604 ; in Il.
o)/lurai, e.g. i(/ppoi . . kri= leuko\n e)repto/menoi kai\ o)lu/ras
5.196
, 8.564 ; a)po\ o)lure/wn poieu=ntai siti/a (sc. oi( *ai)gu/ptioi) , ta\s zeia\s metece/teroi kale/ousi
Hdt. 2.36
, cf. Eup. 14
D. , X. An. 5.4.27 , Str. 15.1.18 , Asclep. ap. Gal. 13.257 : in sg., zeia\ a(plh=
Dsc. 2.89
( v.l. ze/a ),= Gal. 6.517 .
rice-wheat, in sg., Thphr. HP 8.9.2 , al. (where o)/lura is a cultural variety); z. di/kokkos,
Triticum dicoccum, Dsc. l.c. ( v.l. ze/a ), Gal. l.c.
zeiga/rh: te/ttic para\ *sidh/tais, Hsch.

zei/dwros, on,
zea-giving ( Plin. HN 18.82 , EM 410.6 ), as epith. of the earth, zei/dwros a)/roura
Il. 2.548
